reference_a:
@article{neubauer2024,
  title = {Approaching academic adjustment on multiple time scales},
  author = {Neubauer, Andreas B. and Schmiedek, Florian},
  date = {2024-02-01},
  journaltitle = {Zeitschrift für Erziehungswissenschaft},
  shortjournal = {Z Erziehungswiss},
  volume = {27},
  number = {1},
  pages = {147--168},
  issn = {1862-5215},
  doi = {10.1007/s11618-023-01182-8}
}
topics: timescales, COVID, academic achievement, study demands
additional_comments: part of the STECCO project; number of participants higher than that included in the paper; more panel datasets available on OSF; some variables use "-1" for "not applicable"

features.name: question_nr
features.coding:
Other categories available for panel data, here: 
dxby = ESM questionnaires; dx indicates the respective day of the ESM phase (x = 1-14), by indicates the respective beep of the day (with y = 1-5 representing quasi-randomized beeps and y = 6 representing end of day questionnaires.

features.name: timestamp
features.coding: Time stamp denoting the quasi randomized time point when the questionnaire was sent out to the particpant

features.name: location
features.coding:
Where are you right now?  1 = At home
2 = With friends
3 = At my university
4 = On the bus, in the train, in the car 5 = Shopping / running errands
6 = Outside (walking, doing sports, ...) 7 = At my workplace
8 = Elsewhere, namely:
features.details: Where are you right now?
features.labels:
1 = At home
2 = With friends
3 = At my university
4 = On the bus, in the train, in the car 5 = Shopping / running errands
6 = Outside (walking, doing sports, ...) 7 = At my workplace
8 = Elsewhere, namely:

features.name: studied
features.coding:
Have you worked for your studies since getting up / since the last survey?
Think of all possible study- related tasks (e.g., attending lectures, working on exercises, reading or researching literature, ...).
1 = yes 2 = no
features.details:
Have you worked for your studies since getting up / since the last survey?
Think of all possible study- related tasks (e.g., attending lectures, working on exercises, reading or researching literature, ...).

features.name: supposed_to_study
features.coding:
Were you supposed to have been working for your studies since getting up / since the last survey?
1 = No, I was at leisure time. 
2 = Yes, but I decided against it.
features.details: Were you supposed to have been working for your studies since getting up / since the last survey?
features.labels:
1 = No, I was at leisure time. 
2 = Yes, but I decided against it.

features.name: study_motivation_others_disappointed
features.coding:
...because others would have been disappointed in me if I had not done so
1 = completely disagree 
7 = completely agree
features.details: I have worked for my studies since getting up / since the last survey because others would have been disappointed in me if I had not done so

features.name: study_motivation_felt_bad
features.coding:
...because I would have felt bad if I had not done this.
1 = completely disagree

features.name: finished
features.coding:
Variable indicating whether the participant reached the goodbye page or not
FALSE = Did not reach good-bye-page
TRUE = Reached good-by page
features.details: Variable indicating whether the participant reached the goodbye page or not
features.labels:
FALSE = Did not reach good-bye-page
TRUE = Reached good-by page

features.name: last_page
features.description: The page most recently answered (and sent via the next button) by the participant

features.name: max_page
features.description: The greatest number of any page answered by the participant.

features.name: too_late
features.coding:
Variable indicating if participants had answered parts of the questionnaire later than intended (i.e., later than the time point when the questionnaire was officially closed). Responses given later than inetnded were set to missing.
0 = all responses given within acceptable time frame
1 = (parts of the) responses given later than intended
features.details: Variable indicating if participants had answered parts of the questionnaire later than intended (i.e., later than the time point when the questionnaire was officially closed). Responses given later than inetnded were set to missing.
features.labels:
0 = all responses given within acceptable time frame
1 = (parts of the) responses given later than intended

features.name: noncompliance_esm
features.coding:
Variable coding if a participant has completed less than 5 beeps per week or has participated only 1 day within a week. Evaluated separately for both study weeks
0 = more than 5 beeps and more than 1 day of data collection
1 = at least 5 beeps but not more than 1 day of data collection
2 = less than 5 beeps but more than 1 day of data collection
features.details: Variable coding if a participant has completed less than 5 beeps per week or has participated only 1 day within a week. Evaluated separately for both study weeks
features.labels:
0 = more than 5 beeps and more than 1 day of data collection
1 = at least 5 beeps but not more than 1 day of data collection
2 = less than 5 beeps but more than 1 day of data collection

features.description: Mother considering from my point of view

Today my mother was willing to consider things from my point of view.
1= completely disagree
7= completely agree
-1 = not applicable (no contact today)
features.details: Today my mother was willing to consider things from my point of view.
features.labels:
1= completely disagree
7= completely agree
-1 = not applicable (no contact today)
features.construct: mother, parents, family, parental autonomy, parenting

features.name: noncompliance_daily
features.coding:
Variable coding if a participant has participated only 1 day within a week
0 = more than 1 day of data collection
1 = only 1 day of data collection
